IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Lyndon Institute is an academic community providing students with excellent preparation for success in school, college, careers, and life.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Lyndon Institute is an academic community providing students with excellent preparation for success in school, college, careers, and life.
IRS990.Description: Lyndon Institute provides a high school education to its students to help prepare them for a successful life. Seven sending towns (Burke, East Haven, Lyndon, Newark, Sutton and Union District #37 which comprises Wheelock and Sheffield) have contracts with Lyndon Institute to accept their students automatically with no admissions needed. There are also various non-sending schools, who offer school choice and foreign overseas students who are a direct result of recruiting efforts through fairs, etc. The non-sending schools and the foreign overseas students are all part of the residential program and are provided dormitory living spaces.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The collection, which consists of library books, periodicals and related material, was acquired through purchases since the School's inception and is not recognized as an asset on the statement of financial position. Purchases of collection items are recorded as decreases in unrestricted net assets in the year in which the items are acquired.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The School's endowment consists of 79 individual funds established for a variety of purposes. Its endowment includes both donor-restricted endowment funds and funds designated by the Board of Trustees to function as endowments. As required by generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), net assets associated with endowment funds, including funds designated by the Board of Trustees to function as endowments, are classified and reported based on the existence or absence of donor imposed restrictions.
RENTAL INCOME: 37768. LOSS ON SALE OF ASSETS: 13412.
RENTAL EXPENSES: 37768. LOSS ON SALE OF ASSETS: 13412.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The School does not advertise for students in that Lyndon Institute is the designated area high school. For the residential students recruiters and Lyndon employees travel to let foriegn students know about the programs that the Institute offers.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: LYNDON RECEIVES STATE MONEY TO PROVIDE PROGRAMS SUCH AS ADULT EDUCATION. THEY ALSO RECEIVED FEDERAL PERKINS PROGRAM ASSISTANCE TO AID IN THE GENERAL COSTS OF TUITION.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Various scholarships and awards granted to graduating students who are pursuing college.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: A committee of 5 individuals (Director of Studies, Dean of Faculty, Assistant Head for Campus Life, Dean of Students and Director of College Career Center) meet to assign students the awards for Honor Assembly. They use a list of students by GPA as well as lists of students and where they intend to attend college. The committee is given a list of awards available by the Administrative Assistant to the Headmaster. The group researches certain awards to assure the student is eligible for the award per the grantor. The group then works with the Business Office and uses the Davenport spreadsheet for month end 12/31/XX to assign the amount available for the award.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: TO FUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE CAMPBELL DORMITORY

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: PURCHASE OF HEATING OIL THROUGH HOPKINS OIL/BOURNE'S

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The members (corporators) of the Institute shall consist of not less than fifty (50) and not more than one hundred fifty (150) plus no more than three School Board members from each School Board of each District which has designated Lyndon Institute as its high school and has been accepted by Lyndon Institute as a sending District.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The corporators of Lyndon Institute elect the Board of Trustees from eligible member of the corporation. The Board of Trustees shall consist of twenty-seven (27) members. The Board of Trustees will be voted on an annual basis at the annual meeting held in September. The Board of Trustees shall select and employ a Headmaster who will be charged with the daily administration and educational leadership of the School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 will be reviewed by the Comptroller and the Assistant Head for Finance prior to filing the return. Once filed, a copy will be provided to the Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: We montior potential conflicts of interest on a regular basis as we prepare our annual financial statement audit. At this time we accumulate a list of all related parties and detail the relationship to the School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The contract and compensation for the Headmaster were discussed in executive session of the Executive Committee on May 17, 2010. Later, at the June 8, 2010 meeting of the Executive Committee, the committee voted to extend the headmaster's contract for three years, adjusted to reflect his current salary. As part of discussions, we did prepare some benchmarks for the committee to look at. We used the four independent high schools in Vermont, Lyndon Institute, St. Johnsbury Academy, Burr & Burton, and Thetford Academy, along with White Mountain School in nearby Bethlehem, NH. No other officers were compensated and there School does not have any key employees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Lyndon Institute is not required to make it Form 1024 available to the general public as they obtained exemption prior to 1973. The Form 990 is made available for public inspection through use of the Guidestar website and upon each individual request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Lyndon Institute makes its governing documents and financial statements available to the public upon each individual request.

The Assistant Head for Finance determines if a change in the independent accounting firm is necessary or the contract term is up. After this determination is made the Business Office will send out an RFP, request for proposal, to firms determined by the Assistant Head for Finance. The Business Office will collect and review the proposals and present them to the Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees. The Finance Committee considers the recommendations of the Business Office and then makes their recommendation to the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees, who then votes to approve the recommendation. For the review of the audited financial statements, the Comptroller and Assistant Head for Finance revieww the draft financial statements and then they present to the Finance Committee for their review and final approval.
